inlineContent.text: Implement this protocol to create custom logic for how game actions are validated,
processed, and how their results are handled. The
is completely self-contained, defining both the verb’s parsing
, etc.) and its execution logic. This eliminates
the need to coordinate changes across multiple files when adding new verbs.

abstract.text: Defines the blueprint for handling a specific game verb (e.g., “take”, “open”, “go”).
Handles the “SCRIPT” command for starting transcript recording.
Implements transcript recording mechanics following ZIL patterns.
Handles the RAISE verb (synonym: LIFT).
Handles the “HELP” command for displaying game help information.
Provides basic interactive fiction command guidance following ZIL traditions.
Handles the “DEFLATE” command for deflating previously inflated objects like balloons, rafts, etc.
Implements deflation mechanics following ZIL patterns.
Handles the “MOVE” command and its synonyms (e.g., “SHIFT”, “SLIDE”), allowing the player
to move or manipulate objects in the game world. This is typically used for objects that
can be moved but not taken, such as moving leaves to reveal something underneath.
Handles the “ENTER” command and its synonyms (e.g., “GO IN”, “GET IN”).
Implements entering objects that serve as doors/passages between locations.
Handles the “PUSH” command and its synonyms (e.g., “PRESS”, “SHOVE”), allowing the player
to push objects.
Handles the “TIE” command for tying objects together.
Implements tying mechanics following ZIL patterns for object binding and connection.
Handles the “BRIEF” command for setting brief description mode.
Controls verbosity of location descriptions following ZIL traditions.
Handles the “READ” command, allowing the player to attempt to read text from an item.
Handles the “VERBOSE” command for setting verbose description mode.
Controls verbosity of location descriptions following ZIL traditions.
Handles the “PULL” command for pulling objects.
Implements pulling mechanics following ZIL patterns, as a complement to PUSH.
Handles the “SMELL” command, providing a generic response when the player attempts
to smell their surroundings or a specific item.
Handles the “xyzzy” command, a classic adventure game easter egg.
Handles the “TASTE” command, providing a generic response when the player attempts
to taste an item.
Handles the “TAKE” command and its synonyms (e.g., “GET”), allowing the player to pick up
an item and add it to their inventory.
Handles any follow-up effects or cleanup after the
step has completed
and its
has been initially handled by the engine.
Handles the “FIND” command.
Handles the “DRINK” command for consuming liquids from various sources.
Separate from eating, this handles liquid consumption with proper container logic.
Handles the “CUT” command and its synonyms (e.g., “SLICE”, “CHOP”).
Handles the “TURN” command for turning objects.
Implements turning mechanics following ZIL patterns for object manipulation.
Handles the “WEAR” command and its synonyms (e.g., “DON”), allowing the player to
equip an item that is wearable.
Handles the “UNLOCK
WITH
” command, allowing the player
to unlock a lockable item using a key.
Handles the “DROP” command and its synonyms (e.g., “PUT DOWN”), allowing the player
to remove an item from their inventory and place it in the current location.
Handles the “DEBUG” command, providing a way for game developers to inspect the
internal state of game entities during development and testing.
Handles the “CLOSE” command, allowing the player to close an item that is openable
and currently open.
Handles the “KISS” command for kissing objects or characters.
Implements kissing mechanics following ZIL patterns for social interactions.
Handles the DANCE verb for dancing, boogieing, or expressing joy through movement.
Defines the blueprint for handling a specific game verb (e.g., “take”, “open”, “go”).
Handles the “THINK ABOUT” command, allowing the player to ponder an item or themselves.
This is a more introspective action, often resulting in a generic or humorous response.
Handles the “SCORE” command, displaying the player’s current score and turn count.
Whether this verb consumes a turn when executed.
Handles the “TURN OFF” command for devices that can be switched on and off.
Handles the “BLOW” command for blowing on objects like candles, fires, wind instruments, etc.
Implements blowing mechanics following ZIL patterns.
A utility handler for creating yes/no confirmation dialogs.
Handles the “ASK” command for asking characters about topics.
Implements communication mechanics following ZIL patterns for character interaction.
Supports both direct asking (“ASK TROLL ABOUT TREASURE”) and two-phase asking
(“ASK TROLL” → “What do you want to ask the troll about?” → “TREASURE”).
Handles the SING verb for singing, humming, or making musical sounds.
Handles the LAUGH verb for laughing, guffawing, or expressing mirth.
Syntax patterns that this verb accepts.
Handles the “KICK” command for kicking objects.
Implements kicking mechanics following ZIL patterns for physical interactions.
Handles the YELL verb for yelling, shouting, or making loud vocalizations.
Handles the “TURN ON” command, allowing the player to activate items that are
considered devices (e.g., light sources).
Handles the “BURN” command.
Handles the “CHOMP” command for biting, gnawing, or chewing actions.
Handles the “OPEN” command, allowing the player to open an item that is openable,
not locked, and not already open.
Handles the “INFLATE” command for inflating objects like balloons, rafts, life preservers, etc.
Implements inflation mechanics following ZIL patterns.
Handles the “THROW” command for throwing objects with optional targets.
Implements object throwing mechanics following ZIL patterns.
Handles the “FILL” command for filling containers with liquids.
Implements container filling mechanics following ZIL patterns.
Handles the “SHAKE” command for shaking objects.
Implements shaking mechanics following ZIL patterns for physical interactions.
Whether this verb requires light to execute.
Processes the action, performing validation and execution in a single unified step.
Handles the “QUIT” (or “Q”) command, allowing the player to end the game session.
Handles the LOOK UNDER verb.
Handles the “LOOK” command and its synonyms (e.g., “L”).
Handles the “RUB” command for rubbing objects.
Implements rubbing mechanics following ZIL patterns for physical interactions.
Handles the “WAIT” command, allowing the player to pass a turn without performing
any specific action other than advancing game time.
Handles the “INSERT
INTO/IN
” command, allowing the player
to place an item they are holding into an open container item.
Handles the “BREATHE” command, an atmospheric command that provides varied responses.
In ZIL traditions, this is a simple command that doesn’t require objects.
Handles the “ATTACK” command and its synonyms (e.g., “FIGHT”, “HIT”, “KILL”).
Implements turn-based combat mechanics with D&D-style character properties.
Handles the “SAVE” command for saving game state.
Provides game save functionality following ZIL traditions.
Handles the “EXTINGUISH” command for lit flammable items like torches, candles, and fires.
Handles the “WAVE” command for waving objects.
Implements waving mechanics following ZIL patterns for physical interactions.
Handles the “RESTART” command for restarting the game from the beginning.
Follows ZIL traditions for game restart functionality.
Handles the “TOUCH” command and its synonyms (e.g., “FEEL”, “PAT”), allowing the
player to physically interact with an item by touching it.
Handles the “LISTEN” command, providing a generic response.
Handles the “INVENTORY” command (and its common synonym “I”), displaying a list
of items currently carried by the player.
Handles the “LOCK
WITH
” command, allowing the player
to lock a lockable item using a key.
Handles the “EXAMINE” command and its synonyms (e.g., “LOOK AT”, “DESCRIBE”), providing
a detailed description of a specified item or the player.
Handles the “KNOCK” command for knocking on objects.
Implements knocking mechanics following ZIL patterns for interactions.
Handles the “SQUEEZE” command for squeezing objects.
Implements squeezing mechanics following ZIL patterns for physical interactions.
The main orchestrator for an interactive fiction game, responsible for managing
the game’s state, running the primary game loop, and coordinating interactions
between the player (via an
), the command
, and the various
game logic handlers (
Handles the “DIG” command for digging with or without tools.
Implements digging mechanics following ZIL patterns.
Handles movement commands (e.g., “GO NORTH”, “NORTH”, “N”), allowing the player to navigate
between locations in the game world.
Handles the “LOOK INSIDE” command and its variants (e.g., “LOOK IN”, “LOOK WITH”).
This command allows players to look inside containers or examine the contents of objects.
By default, it delegates to examine behavior, but specific items can override this via ItemEventHandlers.
Handles the “RESTORE” command for restoring saved game state.
Provides game restore functionality following ZIL traditions.
All of the verb synonyms that can match
in the syntax rules to trigger this action handler.
Handles the CRY verb for weeping, sobbing, or expressing sadness.
Handles the “EAT” command for consuming food items.
This handler manages food consumption with proper container logic and state changes.
Handles the “TELL” command for telling characters about topics.
Implements communication mechanics following ZIL patterns for character interaction.
Handles the “POUR” command for pouring liquids on or into objects.
Implements pouring mechanics following ZIL patterns for liquid manipulation.
Handles the CLIMB ON verb (synonyms: SIT ON, STAND ON).
Handles the “CLIMB” command, allowing the player to climb objects.
Handles the “JUMP” command and its synonyms (e.g., “LEAP”, “HOP”).
Implements jumping behavior following ZIL patterns.
Handles the “NIBBLE” command, which typically means to eat something in small bites.
Demonstrates the disambiguation pattern where ambiguous commands trigger yes/no questions
to clarify player intent (e.g., “Do you mean you want to eat the apple?”).
Handles the “GIVE” command and its synonyms (e.g., “DONATE”, “OFFER”), allowing the player
to give items to other actors.
Handles the “PUT
ON
” command, allowing the player
to place an item they are holding onto a surface item.
Handles the “UNSCRIPT” command for stopping transcript recording.
Implements transcript recording mechanics following ZIL patterns.
Handles the “EMPTY” command for emptying containers of their contents.
Implements emptying mechanics following ZIL patterns.
Handles the CURSE verb for swearing, cursing, or expressing frustration.
Handles the “REMOVE” command and its synonyms (e.g., “DOFF”, “TAKE OFF”), allowing the
player to unequip an item they are currently wearing.
